media.title:
*NOW SHOWING*
Stick-figure light-puppets that are controlled by your movement.
Embodied Light Beacons by @lozanohemmer - 31 August 2022 to 1 January 2023 at @crystalbridgesmuseum

Diverting 50,000 litres water per hour through the gallery, where you can dip in, before it flows back to the Main River. #soundon 
Diversion by @asaaddo - 25 June to 25 September 2022 at @kunsthalle_portikus (video by @vernissagetv)

A temperature-controlled room hosting a flickering plane of light. Glass microspheres are hand-painted onto the exterior of the cube structure, where a spectrum of white light shimmers as you move around.
The Cold Room by #MaryCorse - 12 to 16 October 2022 at @friezeofficial #FriezeMasters (video by @pacegallery)

Dancers in motion capture suits, containing 17 sensors, to control visual effects in real-time. #soundon
Anti-Body by @whitleydance @ulcollective @fenyceworkspace, soundtracks by @hannahpeelmusic @kincaid_official - 6 to 8 October 2022 at @sadlers_wells

*NOW SHOWING*
18 headless figures made of straw balance a black tabletop on their backs. As the figures try to claim and inhabit the round head, the edge of the table rises and falls, causing the head to continually roll across the tableâs surface. 
Round Table by @choeuram â 9 September 2022 to 26 February 2023 at @mmcakorea @hyundai.artlab

A 3D printed underwater robot based on the structure of archaea, a group of unicellular micro-organisms believed to be the oldest form of life on earth adapted to life in extreme conditions.
ArchaeaBot: A Post Climate Change, Post Singularity Life-form by @annadumitriuart @alexmayarts - 2021, shown at @artlaboratoryberlin

Huggable lights with faux fur and knitted fabric exteriors. The increased pressure from a hug causes the light to get brighter.
Pluck & Hug MK2 by @harveyandjohn - 2017

An installation designed to store and circulate the breath of a person forever. The apparatus hangs on a wall and is activated 10,000 times a day, the typical respiratory frequency for an adult at rest, including 158 sighs.
Last Breath by @lozanohemmer â 2012, at @fundaciontef

Six figures gyrate about a central figure that leads the dance. Small bells atop each of the wands bobble and jingle with increased frenzy as the dance builds to a climax. #soundon
Witch Dance by #LenLye @lenlyefoundation - 1965, exhibited 2017 at @chchartgallery

A system of cogs and pulleys churn out a colourfully woven rope.
The Nervous Systems by @conradshawcross - 2003 at @entwistlegallery

660 lights connected to Ethereum blockchain, each affected by the natural wind and itâs digital representation stored at Ethereum blockchain. Each owner of the token controls their light animation by sending transactions over the blockchain.
LightOnChain byÂ @404.zero &Â @hanrgb â 10 October 2022 to 10 October 2023 at @kaplankaya

*NOW SHOWING*
Five painted glass plates that rotate around a metal axis and appear to be a single circle when viewed at a distance of one meter.
Rotative plaques verre by #MarcelDuchamp - 2 April to 3 October 2022 at @mmkfrankfurt (video by @vernissagetv)

A site-specific, kinetic sculpture conceived for an unused industrial space at the La Vega Weapons Factory.
ECLYPSES by @spyurbanart - 26 to 28 August 2022 at @link.ovd

An indoor, artificial cloud created through climate engineering, which visitors can experience and interact with.
Cloudscape by @transsolar_klimaengineering and Tetsuo Kondo â 2010 at @labiennale (video by @vernissagetv)

'Whoever finds themselves is like the sun.'

72 interactive light modules powered by solar panels, created with students focusing on sustainability in design and art.
I am the Sun by @keine_angst - 2022 at @tumocenter

Multiplying a simple shape, a poetic movement emerges from the collection.
WIP of Hola Hoop by @collectifscale - 2022

A machine that generates pottery objects using an analogue version of parametric design.
Less NÂ°1 Catenary Pottery Printer by @gt2p â 2014

A composition of sound and light with fast spinning ropes. #soundon
CYCLES by @martin___messier___ - 2022

A multimedia performance exploring
relationships between the human body and artificial entities. #soundon 
Oscilla by @daniele.fabris (performance by @simone_arganini) - 12 June 2022 at @ferraraoff

An interactive exhibit where visitors can draw freeform bedrooms, living rooms and bathrooms, which then get populated with furniture and added to a massive, anarchic city, built on everyoneâs drawings. 
Biennale Bedroom by @johnporral â 22 May to 21 November 2021 at Spanish Pavilion, @labiennale

2940 bespoke LED cubes suspended in a voxel above, using a coded set of rules to exhibit complex behaviours. Dynamic patterns of light emerge, repeat, mutate and dissipate in a constant state of metamorphosis, exploring the creative limits of artificial intelligence.
Lux Automata by @jasonbrugesstudio @deepmind - 2022 (video by @hotmilkfilms )

Tears of the artist is collected and stored in tiny bottles, each sustaining a sealife of algae.
How To Make An Ocean by @studiomolga @kasiainstaexperiment â 7 to 11 Sept 2021, at @arselectronica

Eight installation units fill up slowly, then the pipes tumble and create a water splash. This movement strikes a vibraphone key, creating an unpredictable composition of sound and movement. #soundon
Odoshi Cloud Sequence by @ronaldvandermeijs â 2020

An experiment of painting a colour-changing looping line.
Making of A loose loop by @thomastrum - 2021 (video by @wootzmedia)

A 100 foot-long denim tunnel where you can crawl, walk, swing, or tumble.
Free Land Scape by @paolapivi - 23 June to 29 July 2022 at @galerieperrotin

A robot that extrudes plastic shapes from PLA waste and spreads these artificial pieces around the exhibition space like virtual brushstrokes. 
RE:PLACES by @carolin_nikolas â 18 June to 4 Sept 2021, at Werkleitz Festival 2021 @european_media_art_platform

These drawing machines do not think; they only act immersed in a movement with no beginning or end.
Making of TORQUE by @loloysosaku #loloysosaku - 12 March to 27 April 2022 at @galeria__alegria

*NOW SHOWING*
A site-specific fog sculpture making visible things invisible and invisible things visible.
Munich Fog (Wave), #10865/I by #FujikoNakaya - 8 April to 31 July 2022 at @haus_der_kunst (video by @vernissagetv)

Quiet evolution of shadows through the cycles of time.
Shadow Through Time, 24-Hour Light Fixture by @nun.tinee - 2019 at @itp_nyu

*NOW SHOWING*
A 12-metre-long tunnel, closed at one end, formed in section from a simplified geometric silhouette of the human body.
Passage by #AntonyGormley - 2016, on show 26 May to 25 September 2022 at @museumvoorlinden

Rings of polarisers rotate and intersect, alternating shades of darkness.
Perpetual Phases by @whyixd - 2021

*NOW SHOWING*
Dancers transform the act of sweeping into a mesmerising performance, moving slowly as they brush grains of rice into patterns, accompanied by a gentle tickling of bells from their ankles.
Our Labyrinth by Lee Mingwei â until 15 June 2022, at @tate

A reel of rope, turning at the speed it burns.
the power of love by @parkerheyl - 2021 (video soundtrack by @_isaachayes)

*NOW SHOWING*
AI generated ink-and-wash paintings projected over a mountain range based on Chinaâs terrain data.
Streaming Stillness by @lllllliu.jiayu - 23 April to 27 November 2022 at @labiennale

12 rainbow machines form 48 rainbows on the walls, where the slightest vibration in the room will affect the arcs to move and fade.
Regenbogenmaschinen byÂ @huber.huberÂ - 2020 atÂ @kunsthaus.zofingen

A machine performs the repeated gesture of trying to light a match without ever achieving it.
Daring machines by Adriana Salazar - 2010

*UPCOMING*
A collection of sonic, electronic and mechanical artworks that examine group behaviours and cyclical systems. Rhythms emerge from the convergent and divergent phases. #soundon 
Phases by @kai.lab_ - 19 to 28 May 2022 at @espaciogallery (Video by @sandrameorme)

Kai.Lab is a London-based arts and design practice founded by Ruby Dixon, Sean Malikides and Marguerite Tricaud. Their projects are driven by the desire to understand the core components of intriguing, complex and beautiful natural phenomena. This exhibition is the first time you will see a whole series of their artworks in the gallery context.

Book your ticket at www.kailaboratory.com

Experiments with recycled ball chains and handmade brass cups. #soundon
WIP by @studiozimoun - 2022

A ceramic plate rocks a south sea pearl back and forth over its surface. #soundon
The Static of Nature by @taneandrews - 2017

A kinetic sculpture that roughly simulates the ridge of your hand with linear actuators.
Mountain on the ridge of your hand by @herelvluis - 2019 at @itp_nyu

Four industrial hanging lamps connected to motors spin in circles at different rates until, after a certain number of random swings, all four move in unison.
Versuch unter Kreisen (Experiment Among Circles) by @juliusvonbismarck â 2012, produced atÂ @cern

*NOW SHOWING* **
A topographical surface rhythm study made to enclose little swarms of glass marbles that holds up river rocks.
By @no_lem â Opens 1 April 2022, at @eksrummet

A contraption made from everyday objects for blowing bubbles. 
Bubbles by @rafaelsommerhalder - 2021

*PERMANENT*
A kinetic sculpture, situated in a vineyard, that moves in response to the variation of wind currents.
Four Lines Up Oblique V by George Rickey â 1977, at @ptleoestate

*NOW SHOWING*
A four-tiered scaffolding placed in a pool of shallow water supports four rectangular metal basins, one on each level. A system of pumps and hoses shoots jets of water upwards, from basin to basin, reversing the usual gravitational flow.
Reversed waterfall by @studioolafureliasson â 1 April 2022 to 5 March 2023, at @c3a_andalucia

An intricate 'pathing' mechanism to drive the swimming movement of a kinetic fish.
Stitched fish by @timlewis.info - 2022

A stage performance augmenting the imagery of water, its dynamic generated by hand.
Acqua Alta â Ink black by @adrienmclaireb - 19 March 2022 at @artrhena

A disparate sequence of scenes directed by the control of light and sound create multiple spaces and circulations. A transparent labyrinth in constant transformation. #soundon
Limbo by @antoniarolaestudi - 4 to 6 February 2022 at @llumbcn

Programmable time-based textiles that are designed to change shape over time. 
Weaved â Programmable Textile by @danazelig â 2016

*NOW SHOWING*
An inhabitable media artwork that uses water, light, vibration and sound to reawaken the senses. #soundon
The Centre by @jasonbrugesstudio - 2022 at @museumofthefuture (video by @sandrameorme)

A series of kinetic sculptures revealing imaginative worlds as you turn the handle to bring them alive.
Lighthouse, Orchids of Delphi by @casey_curran - 10 December 2021 to 8 January 8th 2022 at @heronarts

An advertisement that uses conductive threads to send electric currents which illuminate the scenes. 
Connecting Thoughts by Kandenko â 2016

*NOW SHOWING*
A beam of light illuminates dust particles of domestic, earthly and cosmic origin, occasionally stirred by movements and breathing. Some of it is the PM 2.5 particles, which include black carbon emissions from burned fossil fuels.
Particular Matter(s) by @studiotomassaraceno - 11 February to 17 April 2022 at @theshedny 
(Video from #wedonotallbreathethesameair at #neugerriemschneider, 2021)

*NOW SHOWING*
Light as a fleeting yet tangible presence playfully roaming alongside a soundscape. #soundon
SPIRALING INTO INFINITY by @wearechildrenofthelight - 21 January to 24 April 2022 at @mu_hybrid_art_house

The installation measures the topography of a human body and compares it to geodata sets of Earth, searching for a most similar location. 
Sleep Like Mountains by @lotta_stoever â 2022

A kinetic art kit that demonstrates the chromatic phenomena; the rotation of three acrylic discs creating unexpected colour formations.
Subtractive Variability by @felipepantone â 2022 for @configurableart

An interactive musical and visual installation that invites you to play the role of a conductor. #soundon
ORCHAâ103 by @remy.bourcois @jonah.am @baptiste_lfb @tristanlemoigne @emileroch - 2021 at @gobelins_ecole

A light sculpture moves in the dark. Gradual variations in the light and the sculpture's behaviour create ever-changing perceptions of the space. #soundon
UNTITLED (Currents) by @karel.burssens - 2 to 5 February 2022 at @dewarande (Video by @jeroenverrecht)

A spatial kinetic installation illuminating the pulse of living nature.
AMPLITUDE by @studio.drift â 2022 at @editionhotels

Resembling an International Style domestic building apparently abandoned to the elements, the major architectural intervention transforms the galleryâs waterside garden into a scene of poetic dereliction and decay.
A Gentle Collapsing II by @alex._hartley - 2016 to 2018 at @victoriamirogallery (Video by #ilesmarkart)

Light sculpture with LED filaments and custom circuit boards.
Neutron Star by @joshuakirsch - 2019

A biofeedback art installation, consisting of soil, light and other sensors, that allows users to feel and see the interior electrical happenings of their plants. 
Perach by @ronensart @edenoffer â 2021 at @spacea.art

*NOW SHOWING*
A CCTV camera is pointed at a single candle flame, where air flow generated by visitorsâ movements alters the flicker of the flame. Video projectors repeat the image multiple times across the gallery walls.
One Candle (Candle Projection) by #NamJunePaik â 10 December 2021 to 27 March 2022, at @nationalgallerysingapore

Expo '70 fountains at Japan's world fair.
Fountains by #IsamuNoguchi - 1970 (Video by #ArnoldEagle, achieved in @noguchimuseum)

An electronic sculpture of a freeform circuit construction style that is capable of playing a near infinite amount of melodic permutations over a predetermined musical scale. #soundon
waldian by @eirikbrandal â 2019

Quantising time through a triangle LFO with custom electronics. #soundon
Chaque Seconde by @gauthierdeplaude - 2021

*NOW SHOWING*
Translating physiological data from live EEG recordings to a light installation during an improvised dance performance.
Moving Photon by @friendred0.0 - 5 to 9 January 2022 at @weareuglyduck

Thermochromic ink activated over a period of time. (Video played at 8x speed)
InkFlux: Crack of Time I by @h0nh1m - 2021 at @artbasel

A fluid church seen through what resembles a vertical water surface.
Reflexion by @adam.cigler @_petrvacek - 1 July to 4 September 2021 at @constellations_de_metz (Supported by @prusalab @signalfestival @makermatty)

Wind powered kinetic installation inspired by reeds growing by the water. #soundon 
Reeds by @keine_angst - 2021

The chandelier-like structure âImpulseâ sends clear liquid and air bubbles into the transparent cylinders attached to its 27 branches. âArgosâ is a 42-channel particle detector, flashing when it detects muons formed in Earthâs atmosphere
Impulse/Argos by @studio_locus_solus â 2018/2021 at @arko_art_center (video by @cenestpasvale / @artsatcern

*NOW SHOWING*
The uninterrupted ballet of ferrofluid contained in small bottles.
Effet de Champ by @stephane_bissieres - 9 October 2021 to 2 January 2022 for @biennalenemo

A kinetic sculpture composed of hammers and light bulbs performing a ritual of periodic motion, carefully choreographed to avoid each other as long as each element of the system continues to function as intended.
The Fragility of Complexity by @neilmendoza - 2021 at @criatechaveiro

650 circular wooden pieces that are cut on an angle. Casting shadows by twisting and rotating in unison, wooden pegs forms your relection and function as a mirror. 
Peg Mirror by @dannyrozin â 2007

Merging artificial intelligence with the history of Turkish cinema.
Alkazar RÃ¼yasÄ± by @refikanadol - 23 November 2021 at @hopealkazar

*NOW SHOWING*
A balancing act formed by a light bulb and a stone driven by gravitational and centrifugal forces.
The Heavy Light by @alicjakwade â 18 October to 27 November 2021, part of Day Density exhibition at @kamelmennour

A luminous red sphere caged inside a scaffolding structure.
Tierra/Earth by @spyurbanart - 2021

A kinetic device that captures the sensation of sneezing.
The Sneeze by @nikramage - 1998

*NOW SHOWING*
A wind-powered kinetic installation where you start the fans to bring it alive.
We Harvest Wind by @thijs_biersteker - 15 October to 3 November 2021 at @stedelijkmuseum, with @polestarcars

A physical/digital toy that sings musical scales â open it a little to sing a low note, and wider a high note. #soundon 
Singing Sock Puppets by @extraordinaryfacility - 2019 ongoing

A kinetic sculpture which requires the visitor's participation to pedal the wheels and animate the objects. 
#33 with bamboo and bicycle by Mika Rottenberg â 11 June to 27 August 2021, at @hauserwirth

*UPCOMING*
Three dancers, isolated yet connected digitally, in an interactive space of motion responsive visual patterns.
Anti-Body by @whitleydance @ulcollective - 26 October 2021 at @oxfordplayhouse (music by @hannahpeelmusic @kincaid_official, video by @sodiumfilms)

Loops of string translating your movements to flowing and ebbing shapes.
String Spring by @mehmetberkbostanci - 2019 at @studioxistanbul @bangprix
